def give_sum(arr):
    sum_value = 0
    b = 0
    while b < len(arr):
        sum_value += arr[b]
        b += 1
    return sum_value

The loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop in the provided Python program is:

`sum_value_i = give_sum(arr[i]->arr[len(arr)-1])`

This invariant ensures that the sum value at each iteration is the sum of the elements in the current subarray. It proves the partial correctness of the program because it ensures that the loop condition `b < len(arr)` is satisfied at each iteration and that the sum value is updated correctly.

def give_sum(arr):
    sum_value = 0
    b = 0
    while b <= len(arr) - 1:
        sum_value += arr[b]
        b += 1
    return sum_value

The loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop in the provided Python program is:

`sum_value_i = give_sum(arr[i]->arr[len(arr)])`

This invariant ensures that the sum value at each iteration is the sum of the elements in the current subarray, from index i to the last element. It proves the partial correctness of the program because it ensures that the loop condition `b <= len(arr) - 1` is satisfied at each iteration and that the sum value is updated correctly.
